ui_change_detection: The diff includes multiple front-end React/TSX changes that clearly affect the UI:

- TaskRunTerminalPane.tsx now uses WorkspaceLoadingIndicator with a new 'terminal' variant, different copy, and error/loading states instead of the previous inline MonitorUp icon + text. This changes the terminal pane's loading and error UI.
- workspace-loading-indicator.tsx adds a new 'terminal' variant with specific loading/error titles and descriptions, plus a new 'action' slot. This changes displayed text and layout where it's used.

- TaskTree.tsx: SidebarArchiveOverlay now takes a groupName ('task' | 'run') and uses group-specific hover/focus classes ('group/task', 'group/run'); structure of the archive button/icon wrapper changed. This changes when and how the archive icon appears for tasks/runs.

- TaskRunTreeInner / TaskRunDetails: restructured leading icons (archive, crown, status), always render VS Code link instead of conditionally, and for Browser/Terminals links now gate on isLocalWorkspace. Added new status indicators (spinner and error icon with tooltip) as trailing UI on VSCode/Browser/Terminals links. All of these are visible UI behavior/appearance changes.

- DashboardComponent route now creates optimistic task runs and populates the task run list immediately for newly created tasks, affecting what users see in the task/run sidebar shortly after creating a task.
screenshot_assessment: The bot stated '**No UI changes detected**' and did not provide any screenshots.
Given the clear UI-related changes above, the bot should have detected UI impact and attempted to capture screenshots of at least:
- The task run details/links section (showing new VSCode/Browser/Terminals links and status indicators).
- The task/run tree where archive overlays and group hover behavior changed.
- The task run terminal pane showing the new WorkspaceLoadingIndicator-based loading/error UI.
Because it concluded there were no UI changes and produced no screenshots, this is a false negative.

notes: The diff contains multiple clear UI changes in React components and shared UI utilities, but the bot stated "No UI changes detected" and produced no screenshots.

In apps/client/src/components/TaskRunTerminalPane.tsx, the loading and error states for the terminal were refactored to use a new <WorkspaceLoadingIndicator variant="terminal" ...>, with different copy, layout (centering only, no stacked icon/text), and an explicit retry button passed as an action. This will visibly change the terminal pane UI in loading/error/empty-session states.

In apps/client/src/components/workspace-loading-indicator.tsx, a new variant "terminal" was added with its own loading/error titles and descriptions, plus an optional `action` prop rendered in the UI. This is directly user-facing.

In apps/client/src/components/TaskTree.tsx there are multiple UI-affecting changes: SidebarArchiveOverlay now accepts a `groupName` and uses scoped Tailwind group classes (group/task, group/run) to control hover/focus behavior, its structure and layout changed (no longer absolutely positioned over the icon, gap/spacing adjusted, icon now rendered conditionally). Task and run links now use `group/task` and `group/run` class names, affecting hover behavior. TaskRunDetails and TaskRunDetailLink had visual tweaks (e.g., removal of `ml-2` on trailing content).

TaskRunDetails now always shows the VS Code and Git diff links, and conditionally shows Browser and Terminals based on `isLocalWorkspace`. It also adds new status indicators (spinner or red X with tooltips) for VSCode/browser/terminal links depending on run status and environment errors. This clearly changes the detail panel UI.

Route preloading behavior in apps/client/src/routes/_layout.$teamSlugOrId.task.$taskId.index.tsx was updated to preload VSCode iframes earlier, which can change perceived loading states and timing of when iframes appear.

Although there are also backend/server changes (agentSpawner, Morph/VSCode integrations, sandboxes routes, and a new bench script), these do not negate the fact that there are substantial front-end UI changes.
Because the bot concluded there were no UI changes and therefore did not generate any screenshots, this is a classic false_negative according to the specified failure modes.

evaluation.notes: The diff clearly includes multiple UI-relevant changes, but the bot concluded 'No UI changes detected' and did not provide any screenshots. Specifically: (1) TaskRunTerminalPane.tsx now uses the shared WorkspaceLoadingIndicator component in several states (no workspace URL, tabs loading, tabs error, and no terminals), changing the loading/error visuals and copy. (2) TaskTree.tsx modifies SidebarArchiveOverlay to use named group hovers (group/task, group/run), alters how archive icons and crown/status icons are arranged and revealed on hover/focus, and always shows additional task run detail links (VS Code, Diff, Browser, Terminals, etc.) with new status indicators, which definitely alters the visible UI and interaction behavior in the task/run tree. (3) workspace-loading-indicator.tsx adds a new 'terminal' variant and an optional action button, changing possible rendered content. Additional route changes preload VSCode/browser iframes but are less visually direct than the TSX changes. Given these substantial front-end/UI modifications, the bot should have detected UI changes and attempted screenshots of the task run terminal pane and task/run tree views. Its assertion of no UI changes is incorrect, resulting in a clear false negative.

The diff contains substantial UI-related changes, but the bot stated 'No UI changes detected' and produced no screenshots. Notable UI changes include: (1) TaskRunTerminalPane.tsx now uses the shared WorkspaceLoadingIndicator component with a new 'terminal' variant for all terminal loading/empty/error states, changing both layout and copy, and adding optional retry actions. (2) TaskTree.tsx has multiple visual and interaction changes: SidebarArchiveOverlay gains a groupName prop and new Tailwind group classes to scope hover behavior, its DOM structure and icon visibility logic change, and archive overlays for tasks vs runs are restructured; the run tree leading icons now combine crown/status icons differently; TaskRunDetails now always shows VS Code and Diff links, conditionally shows Browser/Terminals for cloud workspaces, and adds explicit loading/error indicators (Loader2, XCircle with tooltip) in the trailing area. (3) workspace-loading-indicator.tsx gains a 'terminal' variant, new copy, and support for rendering an action element, modifying the rendered UI. Other changes (server-side Morph/VSCODE setup and benchmarking) are backend-only. Because there are clear React/TSX/UI component and styling changes and the bot neither acknowledged them nor provided screenshots, this is a clear false_negative and offers no value for UI review.
